title: Ebiokpobo
author: Ebiokpobo
content: Good day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.

comments.author: bhadz
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.Welcome to the forum, make sure that you read these guidelines for your reference and you won't make a mistake by breaking some forum rules.Newbies - Read before postingUnofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Read the sticky threads on Meta and beginners & help.You will see the sticky threads as the first topics (at the top) on each board.Edit:You have created similar topic before. Why this again. If you do not take time to go through all the boards on this forum one by one and see how the topics there are, you may not understand this forum. If you want to rank up, start posting something meaningful and useful on the boards that you like. The more you stay the more you will understand more about this forum.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: How many times are you going to create this type of thread? When you created your account you created this thread;  Am a newcomer here please help and guide. and I’m sure you didn’t even bother to go back to that thread and read the replies that were made and I believe the same thing is going to happen here.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.Why ask the same question again if you already got the answer/s?Am a newcomer here please help and guide.I don't understand if the problem is that you don't understand how the forum works, you have some doubts about what Bitcoin actually is, or you were told that you can make some money here and now you're wondering how to do it?

comments.author: BRINIRHA
comments.body: When you can create your own topic then that is a good step. The next step is to try to reply to people who provide suggestions and responses to your topic. And if you can do it. Then you just have to obey all the rules in this forum. By reading the guidelines and rules of this forum. So that you understand what you can do and what you can't do.So for starters I think you should spend more time to read the forum rules slowly. After that, start exploring the boards that interest you. And because this is a bitcoin forum, of course you also have to learn about Bitcoin and crypto. After that, start discussing more actively in this forum. Don't hesitate to ask if there is still something you don't understand. But try not to repeat the same question unless your previous question has not received an answer. The point is, don't spam and don't go off topic.

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: It seems like you've created two threads with similar content. It might appear that you're eager to learn about this forum, but you've made a mistake because what you created could be seen as a duplicate post, not literally, but in terms of content.Since they've already suggested some tips on how you can learn, I'm sure that's a lot to read, but you'll be happy if you're really interested.I'm just curious, can it be my turn to ask? What brought you here? I mean, did anyone tell you that you can make money on Bitcointalk?

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.Just as those who come here as beginners, many of them are not immune from learning and have a strong desire to learn everything on this forum, so do I, a basic beginner, OP there are many things you can know here, especially about Bitcoin, especially crypto, where little by little, day by day everything you want to know will be achieved, as well as the achievements you get.OP, in this thread I see there are many things that have been given by other members who have come to this thread, in essence: you have to believe and learn about what you want to know, Don't hesitate to ask what you don't know and give your ideas here which are meaningful to other members here, that way you can easily find out about the journey in this forum.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on October 12, 2023, 12:19:57 PMQuote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.Why ask the same question again if you already got the answer/s?Am a newcomer here please help and guide.I don't understand if the problem is that you don't understand how the forum works, you have some doubts about what Bitcoin actually is, or you were told that you can make some money here and now you're wondering how to do it?It seems that some newcomers coming to the forum not only do not know how to read but also do not know how to watch. Aren't there enough topics open, like "I don't know how to start"? I would like to create statistics on the number of people who do not see or read at all, and what will happen to them in the future. I’m just sure that those who are really interested in the forum, crypto, and community life will cope with the first steps on their own, and we see good participants. But people like this OP are just random guys who aren't even worth wasting your time on. But people, like parrots, write the same thing from topic to topic, offering ways and materials for reading. What's wrong with you, OP?

comments.author: Eureka_07
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.First thing that you might want to learn is read replies on your thread. Have you ever read the replies from your first post? You have to use some of your time to read and navigate. Your interest seems to be on and off. Welcome to the forum though. Go to the Help menu too and navigate through the page.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.You have created an account and already created a thread in an appropriate section. So, I believe you already started to understand how it works. I am sure you will understand almost everything in a couple of weeks if you stay active in the forum. Now if you want some suggestions: I will suggest you read more and more. Don't write too many posts and do not create unnecessary threads if not needed. Dig out threads and read more to know things and get familiar with the forum. The only way to gather knowledge is to explore the forum and ask questions only when you do not understand something.

comments.author: Shamm
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.Good day Op welcome to the forum as a newbie like you you need to understand what is this forum all about and what are the does and don't here in our community, and as a newbie all I can say or advice is you need to follow the Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ in order to grow faster and avoid some mistakes cause once you made a big mistakes then you will be face the consequences here in forum.Also you can read the  [SEPTEMBER UPD.] Beginners & Help Encyclopedia made by  one of the best contributors here in forum  @Ratimov. This thread by ratimov is your guide to gathered  more knowledge.Op good luck to your journey here in forum and once again welcome to the community.

comments.author: Ruttoshi
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.OP, if I am not mistaken, it is 6-7 weeks now after you created similar topic on the 27th of August, and you still came here to ask the same questions on how to cope with the forum. This shows that you are not learning or trying to add effort on learning, if not by now based on the response that you got from your other thread, you should have understand a little of how things work here.It is you choice to remain as a newbie or to grow your account by exploiting knowledge from the forum. I don't see that zeal in you to learn and grow here, if not by now, you should have understand how to go about in this forum. I wouldn't give you any article to read or advise because a lot was given to you in your previous thread, so ho back to that thread and read every article that was provided for you. You can start from there if you are serious to learn and understand.

comments.author: goxcraft
comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk. Read these thread in order to understand how bitcointalk works .Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQNewbies - Read before postingBitcointalk Posting EtiquetteMake Your Topic Title, Posts More AttractiveCampaign to Improve Posting Quality for Local BoardsTopic Title Style Guide[GUIDE] Bitcointalk Forum Etiquette

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Quote from: Cantsay on October 12, 2023, 12:19:03 PMHow many times are you going to create this type of thread? When you created your account you created this thread;  Am a newcomer here please help and guide. and I’m sure you didn’t even bother to go back to that thread and read the replies that were made and I believe the same thing is going to happen here.  And that's just the problem with them.   No time to read and make research, just come up to the forum and create a thread as if we need to be reminded they are noobs. As of the rank beneath their names doesn't say it all. My question to the op; how do you expect to learn if you take for granted these little things? Honestly, if you couldn't gain a thing or two from your previous thread and still felt the need to create a topic for the same thing, then I feel these guides other users have provided for you will be useless.

comments.author: komisariatku
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.Many senior members will provide you with links regarding forum rules. Hopefully you have time to read it because it is important. This forum is quite strict and if it is violated it will have a bad impact on you.A little advice for you, that this forum strictly prohibits all forms of plagiarism and you are also not allowed to use AI to comment. Become a regular member and write down letter by letter every thought or opinion you have. There is no way to speed up your account ranking, so enjoy the forums and discussions. Everything will be fine if you have no intention of cheating here. Welcome to the forums

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.One of the ways things work here in the forum is that when you create a thread with the aim of getting any information, it is expected that you go back to the thread and read all you have been told. This is the way you can learn and grow in the forum. From your post history, you have asked similar question before and the thread has about two pages. I doubt if you went back to the thread to read all you have been told. If you did that, I don't think you will still duplicate such questions. You have to understand that this forum has zero tolerance for spamming. I want to also add that you should avoid plagiarism and the use of bots to make posts. Plagiarism will lead to a permanent ban, therefore ensure you reference the sources of your posts. I hope you will spend time to read the information you will get from this thread.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.Welcome to this forum, I hope you will love your time here and will learn new things and BTC technology will open new gates of opportunities for you. It all depends on you, and how you take this forum. This Forum is full of wonders, especially then, when you get to know the role it has played in the BTC development. And for that, I recommend you to read this thread:The most iconic bitcointalk threads. History on Bitcointalk.And further, if you want to know the norms and regulations of this forum, then the following threads will be of great use to you. All you need is to spend some time reading them if you really want to get some respect from here. Comprehensive guide to Bitcointalk. Newbie friendly + calculator and infographic[SEPTEMBER UPD.] Beginners & Help Encyclopedia--> This is an encyclopedia made by Ratimov and you can find all the relevant topic in the link.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.You are welcome mate. This is a forum where all cryptocurrency discussions take place. You’re in a safe place. This is the most reliable source of information about cryptocurrencies. However, follow the rules and regulations of the forum. People who commented before me have already provided you with some helpful links that will guide you through the forum without any problems if you follow what you see.Don’t plagiarise. This is the most common thing newcomers do here and get their account banned. Don’t copy anything online and claim it as your own. If you are caught, you will have your account permanently banned, so be careful. And again, don’t hesitate to ask questions; anything you don’t understand, ask, and they will guide you.

comments.author: 2Pizza410000BTC
comments.body: Quote from: Ebiokpobo on October 12, 2023, 12:12:44 PMGood day everyone, I'm still a newbie to this forum and I'm yet to understand how the platform works, and I'd like to get helpful tips on how to get started, so I'm asking the senior members of the forum for assistance.First of all I would like to thank you for coming to Bitcoin forum. Since you are new and don't know many rules and how to work here, you must devote enough time here. When you donate enough time here you will learn all the rules and how to post by yourself. But you have to press my advance advice well here no plagiarism or scam. If you do all these things then you will not be able to survive in the forum. Surviving this forum is hard and easy. But all these things will depend on you. Hope you have a great journey here.
